bibl.title: Letter from [Jefferson Randolph Kean] to Juan Guiteras, November 17, 1908

div1.p: [Kean] requests additional experiments using wire mesh as a mosquito control.

div1.head: Letter from [Jefferson Randolph Kean] to Juan Guiteras, November 17, 1908
div1.opener:
FROM GEN. J. R. KEAN
Havana, November 17, 1908.
My dear Dr. Guiteras:
div1.p:
Since your visit this morning, I have read with interest
your report on the effectiveness of 16 mesh wire for stopping
stegomyiae. It would add very much to the value of this study
if you would repeat the experiments with some other varieties
of mosquitoes, such as culex pungens, solicitans and anopheles.
I hope you will put one of your assistants to work on this
and give us in this way a complete report.
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely, Adviser to Sanitary Department. Dr. Juan Guiteras,
Director Las Animas Hospital,
Habana.
